intro: Impatiens alboflava, commonly known as the white-flowered impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in horticulture for its delicate appearance and ease of care.
